* is [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivore "Herbivore").

* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                               |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | [monst.c#line3151](/wiki/Monst.c#line3151 "Monst.c")                                                                          |

The **abbot**, @, is a [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian"). They are capable of [clerical spell-casting](/wiki/Monster_spell#Clerical_Spells "Monster spell"), and their melee attacks are more powerful than other quest guardians, reflecting the monk's affinity towards martial arts.

Like all monsters that have [stunning](/wiki/Stunning "Stunning") attacks, eating an abbot's corpse inflicts [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination")[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) and is considered [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism") (as monks can only be humans in vanilla), but this will not come up outside of a situation where [the game is already lost](/wiki/Unwinnable "Unwinnable").

## Generation

Unlike other quest guardians, and like their [Grand Master](/wiki/Grand_Master "Grand Master") and [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)"), abbots are not [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon").

## Encyclopedia entry

For it had been long apparent to Count Landulf that nothing  
could be done with his seventh son Thomas, except to make him  
an Abbot or something of that kind. Born in 1226, he had from  
childhood a mysterious objection to becoming a predatory eagle,  
or even to taking an ordinary interest in falconry or tilting  
or any other gentlemanly pursuits. He was a large and heavy and  
quiet boy, and phenomenally silent, scarcely opening his mouth  
except to say suddenly to his schoolmaster in an explosive  
manner, "What is God?" The answer is not recorded but it is  
probable that the asker went on worrying out answers for himself.

\[ The Runaway Abbot, by G. K. Chesterton ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1107](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/eat.c#L1107)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.](/images/3/37/Nh364-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Abbot

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ abbot
Difficulty 8
Attacks Claw 8d2, Kick 3d2 stun, Spell-casting (clerical)
@ abbot
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Claw 8d2, Kick 3d2 stun, Spell-casting (clerical)

Base level 5
Base experience 66
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 20
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

An abbot:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line3151

The abbot, @, is a Monk quest guardian. They are capable of clerical spell-casting, and their melee attacks are more powerful than other quest guardians, reflecting the monk's affinity towards martial arts.

Like all monsters that have stunning attacks, eating an abbot's corpse inflicts hallucination[1] and is considered cannibalism (as monks can only be humans in vanilla), but this will not come up outside of a situation where the game is already lost.

Generation

Unlike other quest guardians, and like their Grand Master and player monster monks, abbots are not generated with a weapon.

Encyclopedia entry

For it had been long apparent to Count Landulf that nothing
could be done with his seventh son Thomas, except to make him
an Abbot or something of that kind. Born in 1226, he had from
childhood a mysterious objection to becoming a predatory eagle,
or even to taking an ordinary interest in falconry or tilting
or any other gentlemanly pursuits. He was a large and heavy and
quiet boy, and phenomenally silent, scarcely opening his mouth
except to say suddenly to his schoolmaster in an explosive
manner, "What is God?" The answer is not recorded but it is
probable that the asker went on worrying out answers for himself.

[ The Runaway Abbot, by G. K. Chesterton ]

References

  1. ↑ src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1107

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.

The {{questmon|abbot|monk|guardian}} They are capable of [[Monster spell#Clerical Spells|clerical spell-casting]], and their melee attacks are more powerful than other quest guardians, reflecting the monk's affinity towards martial arts.

Like all monsters that have [[stunning]] attacks, eating an abbot's corpse inflicts [[hallucination]]{{refsrc|src/eat.c|1107|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} and is considered [[cannibalism]] (as monks can only be humans in vanilla), but this will not come up outside of a situation where [[unwinnable|the game is already lost]].

==Generation==
Unlike other quest guardians, and like their [[Grand Master]] and [[player monster]] [[Monk (player monster)|monks]], abbots are not [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] a [[weapon]].
